intro: Quiina guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese quiina, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
